version_description:
*A new, cleaner look for the Manchester Evening News 
*Bug fixes to improve the experience 
*We have enabled a Location tool to allow us to offer local offers and vouchers

We’ve fixed some more bugs, and continued to improve the speed of the app.  

As always, if you're experiencing issues, please contact: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

We’ve fixed a bug to do with content updating, and we’ve made some performance improvements to articles.  

As always, if you're experiencing issues, please contact: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

We've made some changes so that push alerts are more relevant to the topics you like.  

We also made a number of background changes that won't be immediately obvious, but which make the app run faster and more efficiently.

Stay tuned for more app updates in the coming weeks, especially if you've had problems with video, or using the app on an iPad.

In the meantime, if you have any questions you can contact us: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com
We fixed the bug where some users were stuck on the No Network Connection screen.

We fixed a bug that was causing the app to crash for some users. We also fixed pull-to-refresh, which was working too slowly in the last update. 

We're still working on the bug where content occasionally fails to auto-update, when opening the app.  

We can't reply to App Store reviews, so if you have any feedback, email us on: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

New in this release we joined the Federal Service, became Citizens and wiped out some bugs! If you get the movie reference then you can feel smug in front of your friends

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

In life we look for compatibility, especially with our partners right?!
So we got all loved up with iOS 11 and made ourselves fully compatible ... its a beautiful thing!

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

Yep its that time again, a minor release to fix some weird things going on. 
Have you ever not been able to scroll an article after you resized the text? Yeah us too, so we sorted it.
From time to time you may have seen two navigation bars, if you clicked an Ad or a weblink? - Proper weird that one, but it won’t happen anymore. 

So in the famous words of Maui; “You’re Welcome”.

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

3.2.3
=====
Continuing our iPhone X improvements, and other little bug fixes

3.2 
===
Hold on to your hats because this release is a biggie! First up, the big three…

- The long awaited commenting feature. Sign up for a free account and join the conversation on any subject that matters to you. Go forth and natter.

- With your free account You can now bookmark articles for reading later and they are also synced to your other iOS devices.

- A new discover feature so you can explore more content and save any topic to your favorites easily

As well as all that we have added an all new tabbed navigation to help you get around even better, we fixed some bugs too, and laid the groundwork for more upcoming features, so stay tuned, this is just the beginning!

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

3.2.3
We've fixed a few little bugs for you.

3.2 
Hold on to your hats because this release is a biggie! First up, the big three…

- The long awaited commenting feature. Sign up for a free account and join the conversation on any subject that matters to you. Go forth and natter.

- With your free account You can now bookmark articles for reading later and they are also synced to your other iOS devices.

- A new discover feature so you can explore more content and save any topic to your favorites easily

As well as all that we have added an all new tabbed navigation to help you get around even better, we fixed some bugs too, and laid the groundwork for more upcoming features, so stay tuned, this is just the beginning!

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

We've fixed tweets not displaying and a few other under the hood updates

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

We are back with a subtle update. Sure we have fixed some bugs like always, but we went a bit further and lashed some love on the video playback. No longer will you struggle on an iPhone X to interact with the controls. You can now even swipe up to dismiss a video, and if you really don't want to watch a video full screen, well now you can. All in all, a far better experience.

Tell us what you think: mobile_app_feedback@trinitymirror.com

This release is a big one. We gave the app some much needed love, actually a lot of love. The app now comes dressed in a lovely new iOS 11 inspired design. Our article teasers now allow you to jump straight to the comments with a single tap, and the ability to add that article to your bookmarks for reading later. We have much more visual treats coming soon, so stay tuned.

Bug Fixes:
Some users who got a push notification only to see the article load with a toolbar and tabbar at the same time. Proper strange and its now fixed!

This release is a big one. We gave the app some much needed love, actually a lot of love. The app now comes dressed in a lovely new iOS 11 inspired design. Our article teasers now allow you to jump straight to the comments with a single tap, and the ability to add that article to your bookmarks for reading later. We have much more visual treats coming soon, so stay tuned.

Bug Fixes:
We have made a number of changes in the background to tidy up the code and minimise potential bugs.

This release is a big one. We gave the app some much needed love, actually a lot of love. The app now comes dressed in a lovely new iOS 11 inspired design. Our article teasers now allow you to jump straight to the comments with a single tap, and the ability to add that article to your bookmarks for reading later. We have much more visual treats coming soon, so stay tuned.

Bug Fixes:
We have made a number of changes in the background to tidy up the code and minimise potential bugs.

We are back with a nice update for everyone. First up we have fixed some annoying bugs. Among them are fixes for article teaser headings that were being cropped quite often, so we have improved that across iPhone and iPad. Also, did you ever see a notification to download an app update you already had? Some of you did, so we have put a fix in place for that too. Other than bugs, we have also improved the UI to help you know what you can tap. The general rule, if it's our brand colour you can tap it! The in app notifications have also been given a lick of paint too! Enjoy.

We are back with just a very quick update to smooth out some wrinkles. We've fixed some reported bugs, done a lot of dusting and house cleaning in the background, emptying the trash, and set some stones in place for later releases. ''Nano Nano''
A quick update to fix some little bugs behind the curtains. We have more on the way so stay tuned for another update coming soon.

In this update we have improved the UX and UI for following your favourite columnist. To do so, tap the article byline and tap follow on the columnists bio, and you will have a brand new tab on My News dedicated to their articles. In my profile you will be able to manage all the columnist you follow in one simple screen. We have also killed some bugs, and improved some informational elements too. Enjoy!
A quick fire release to fix some small bugs and small UI tweaks. We are hard at work improving some important features within the app and will be back soon with another new shiny update. Ciao for now

We are back with a bug fix release that fixes some push notification issues for a small section of our users. Also some users were experiencing issues with pull to refresh, and loading articles from the teasers, so some improvements have been made there too. Stay tuned for more updates soon, au revoir!
We are back with a quick fire update, to fix a few of behind the scenes issues to make sure your experience is as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
This update includes lots of behind the curtain changes, stay tuned as we are working very hard on a big release for later on this quarter.

In this update we have again been fixing some issues and bugs. We have also provided a way for you to delete your account from the My Details section, and removed some unimportant profile sections. We are still working very hard on a much bigger release so stay tuned!

We have been promising a big update has been coming for a long time, and now finally we can say it's here! Below are just a few highlights available in our all new app

• Brand new Tap a Tag feature! Just like reddit you can tap tags in article teasers or articles in order to discover more related content, it's a whole new way to navigate and find the content you like in the app!
• An all new cleaner design for iPhone and iPad to help you find and read articles that interest you.
• You can now select the contrast colour of the type in articles, giving you a more personal reading experience
• A new comment history section has been added to My Account, so you can find all the comments you made in past articles.
• Speaking of comments, we have completely over hauled the experience to make it easier to see the latest comments first, a better way to see replies to comments and subscribe to your comment, so if you get a reply we'll notify you.
• The app has been rebuilt from the ground up to work on modern frameworks and architecture in order to fix all those annoying bugs in the previous version of the app

We aren't stopping there, we have even more new features on the way and enhancements to olds ones, stay tuned it's going to be a big couple of months!

A quick fire update to correct some issues with the new app.

- We have fixed the Live stories issue where some users didn't see the live content load.
- We have also cleaned up some UI issues, and fixed some minor bugs.
Another quick fire release to fix some bugs and issues which some users have been seeing. Stay tuned we have a big update coming very soon.

We have a big update for you today, here are just some of the highlights:

• Dark Mode! Yep we support iOS13 Dark Mode setting! If you don't have iOS 13, you can still use dark mode by setting it manually in the app under the "My Account" tab.
• Saving a Tag! Finding related content using tags is great, but now you can save your favourite tags to get to that content even faster.
• Discover Updates! Access your saved Tags and saved Authors from the Discover view and we also gave Discover a quick lick of paint too.
• Stability improvements across the board, especially for legacy iOS devices.
• Many smaller UI and code improvements to make your experience better.

We have even more in the pipeline as well, exciting times, so stay tuned!

Here is a super fast update, to fix a known iOS 13.1 issue. So if you have been browsing an article and suddenly you were whisked off to a whole new page without consciously tapping a link... then this build is for you, because we stopped that. Now browsing and tapping is what you would expect. Sweet!

This update is all about fixing things, our little elves have been busy behind the scenes sorting out a lot of things that were wonky.

• Dark Mode will now respond no matter where you are in the app - because, well it should do - our bad.
• Have you been in an article and seen content jumping up and down? No... okay well you won't now either.
• Lots of minor fixes here and there, too many to mention and mostly only the developers understand.
A quick bug fix release to address an issue that prevents some users from seeing any content. We are sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Whats new in this release:
- This update provides some much needed back end changes to make your experience faster and more robust
- We have made some smaller design changes here and there in order to improve discoverability of features
- We have laid the foundations to support Sign in with Apple, so you can use your secure Apple ID to register and sign into a free account.
This update is very much a maintenance release, fixing some issues and laying some foundations for future updates.

We are back with a small, but notable update. In this release you will see:

- Sign in With Apple. Yes you can now use your Apple ID to login and get access to all the apps features.
- Following an author has been updated, now tap on the author’s name to see their bio and all their recent articles.
- Commenting got some love, did you ever see comments cutting off? We did too, but you won’t now. Also we improved the “Blocked Words” filter, so please be friendly to your fellow commenters.

Of course we included some other bug fixes and laid the foundations for more to come.
StayHome - StaySafe - ProtectTheNHS

We have added a new feature in this shiny new release:

"Manage Your Storage". This will allow you to free up valuable room on your device, as well provide you a way to remove saved content much faster. You can find this feature in the My Account section.

As always, we included some fixes and behind the scenes work preparing the app for future updates.

This update marks a big change for User Accounts and Commenting going forward in order to address a number of issues. In this release, we have updated the user accounts back end, what does this mean for you?
 • You will be automatically logged out of your account upon installation, so you will need to log back in again. We are sorry for the small inconvenience but it is a necessary step to ensure your data security. If you don't remember your login details, you can use the "Forgot Password" feature to reset it.
 • Commenting on articles is temporarily suspended. This feature is getting a huge overhaul, and will be turned back on again as soon as possible, we are very sorry but this is just unavoidable at this time due to the new user account security.
Also in this update is a fix for a small number of users that have been experiencing battery drain while the app is not being used. We will continue to monitor this issue going forward, if you are still experiencing battery drain in the background with this release, please use the in app feedback to get in touch.

Just a small update to keep thinks moving forward, improvements for this release include:
 • More improvements to a battery drain issue some users are experiencing. We will continue to monitor this going forward.
 • The app will no longer require your location, or ask for permission to use it.
 • The usual bug fixes and some polishing.
Commenting update: It’s still being worked on and we hope to switch the service back on again soon.

New for this release: Home screen Widgets! 

Yes, you can now add your very own news widget to the home screen to live with all your apps. 

You can choose from small, medium and large widgets, and you can customise the widget by flipping it over and selecting your favourite news topic. 

You can even have multiple versions of the widget side by side, running different news topics and at different sizes! 

We have also included some behind the scenes fixes and upgrades to keep your experience silky smooth.
This release is all about cleaning the closet. We have removed some cobwebs, spring cleaned some code, and polished a few bits and bobs. There is much more to come, so stay tuned. #StaySafe
